text: How does the MacBook Air compare to the
MacBook Pro? Apple's entry-level Air
starts at 1,000 or 1,200 depending on
size. For that, you get a good display,
fast processor, up to 18 hours of
battery life, the Magic Keyboard with
Touch ID, and all of that fits in a much
smaller, lighter design. On the other
hand, this is the MacBook Pro starting
at 1,600 or 2500 for the larger size.
Compared to the Air, it has a much
better, brighter 120 Hz display, up to
24 hours of battery life, improved
speakers, microphones, and a much better
port selection. Plus, because there's a
fan, even the base model that has the
same exact chip as the Air gets better
sustained performance. You can also
upgrade the 14-in to the M4 Pro or Max
for up to two times faster CPU and three
times faster GPU performance. Or choose
the 16-in model that only comes with the
M4 Pro or Max, hence the higher starting
price. Subscribe if that was helpful.
